user_input: What is NASA's Deferred Resignation Program for employees considering early separation and how does it work regarding pay, benefits, and administrative leave until final resignation date?
reference_contexts:
["<1-hop>

page_content=' Final Separation Agreement

This agreement is between the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (“NASA”

or “Agency”) and the Employee identified below.

On June 9, 2025, NASA circulated an email communication to employees offering them a voluntary deferred resignation option. The offer stated that those employees who accept the offer will not be subject to any reduction in pay and benefits by NASA and exempted them from all applicable in-person work requirements until or earlier if they choose to accelerate the resignation date for any reason. (“ Deferred Resignation Program”).

the Deferred Resignation Program and the Agency accepts Employee’s request to be included in the Deferred Resignation Program. Accordingly, the p arties agree as follows:

NASA has

received Employee’s voluntary

request

to be

included

in

1. Employee is accepted into the Deferred Resignation Program in accordance with the terms of this agreement.

2. Employee shall be placed on paid administrative leave on (the “", "<2-hop>

page_content='Final Separation Agreement

This agreement is between the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (“NASA”

or “Agency”) and the Employee identified below.

On June 9, 2025, NASA circulated an email communication to employees offering them a voluntary deferred resignation option. The offer stated that those employees who accept the offer will not be subject to any reduction in pay and benefits by NASA and exempted them from all applicable in-person work requirements until or earlier if they choose to accelerate the resignation date for any reason. (“Deferred Resignation Program”).

the Deferred Resignation Program and the Agency accepts Employee’s request to be included in the Deferred Resignation Program. Accordingly, the p arties agree as follows:

NASA has

received Employee’s voluntary

request

to be

included

in

1. Employee is accepted into the Deferred Resignation Program in accordance with the terms of this agreement.

2. Employee shall be placed on paid administrative leave on (the “Administrative Leave Start Date”). Employee shall remain on paid administrative leave up through and including or such earlier date on which Employee may choose to resign or otherwise separate from federal service (Deferred Resignation Period).

3. Employee agrees to turn in all Agency equipment and property no later than the Administrative Leave Start Date, as directed by Employee’s supervisor.

4. Employee shall not be expected to work during the Deferred Resignation Period and shall be exempt from any return-to-office requirements.

5. During the Deferred Resignation Period, Agency shall continue to pay Employee’s current salary and Employee shall continue to retain and receive all benefits of Employee’s federal employment, including but not limited to TSP contributions, health, dental, vision and/or any other similar benefits, with the Agency making the government’s contribution. Employee will receive retirement service credit during the deferred resignation period consistent with the retirement provisions applicable to Employee. If Employee becomes eligible for a within- grade increase during the deferred resignation period, the Agency shall process the within- grade increase and Employee shall receive the associated salary increase.

6. Employee will continue to accrue annual and sick leave during the deferred resignation period. Employee will receive a lump sum payment of accrued annual leave in accordance with 5 CFR part 550 upon separation from service.

7.

If there is a lapse in appropriations during the Deferred Resignation Period Employee shall be subject to any lapse and entitled to any back pay consisted in the same manner as any other NASA employee. Employee will retain all existing rights covering such lapse in appropriations regardless of their status as a Deferred Resignation Program participant

1

Version: June 12, 2025

including but not limited to receiving back pay consistent with the Government Employee Fair Treatment Act of 2019.

8. Agency shall comply with all terms of this agreement even if Employee’s position is eliminated or reassigned prior to . Employee shall not be subject to furlough, termination, reduction in force or layoff as a result of an agency-initiated reorganization or reduction in force. Employee agrees to cooperate with steps taken by Agency to exempt Employee from any reduction in force.

9. Nothing in this agreement prevents Employee from retiring from federal service at any time if Employee is eligible to do so under the applicable provisions of CSRS or FERS prior to . If Employee is eligible and elects to retire before , Employee’s retirement election shall override any benefits that would be available to Employee under this agreement after the effective date of Employee’s separation. Employee understands that Employee is responsible for submitting a CSRS or FERS application."]
reference: NASA's Deferred Resignation Program is a voluntary option offered to employees on June 9, 2025. Under this program, employees who are accepted will be placed on paid administrative leave starting on an agreed date (the "Administrative Leave Start Date") and will remain on this status through their deferred resignation date or earlier if they choose to resign sooner. During this Deferred Resignation Period, employees maintain their current salary with no reduction in pay or benefits. They continue to receive all federal employment benefits including TSP contributions, health, dental, vision coverage with the government making its contribution, and retirement service credit. Employees also continue to accrue annual and sick leave and will receive a lump sum payment for accrued annual leave upon separation. Additionally, they are exempted from all in-person work requirements, are not expected to work during this period, and must turn in all Agency equipment by the Administrative Leave Start Date. The program also protects employees from furlough, termination, reduction in force, or layoff due to agency reorganization. Employees retain the option to retire earlier if eligible under CSRS or FERS provisions, though this would override benefits available under the agreement after separation.
groundedness_score_reasoning: The context provides comprehensive and detailed information about NASA's Deferred Resignation Program, including its key features such as paid administrative leave, continued full salary and benefits, exemption from return-to-office requirements, leave accrual, and protection from furlough or reduction in force, which directly and fully addresses all aspects of the question.
relevancy_score_reasoning:
This question is highly useful for HR specialists, supervisors, and program administrators managing Deferred Resignation Program cases. It directly addresses key aspects of the DRP by seeking comprehensive information about the program's mechanics, including critical areas such as:

1. Program Overview: Provides a foundational understanding of the Deferred Resignation Program's purpose and structure.

2. Financial Implications: Explores pay considerations during the deferred resignation period, which is crucial for both employees and HR planning.

3. Benefits Continuity: Addresses how employee benefits are handled during the transition period, a significant concern for participants.

4. Administrative Leave Details: Clarifies the administrative processes and leave arrangements during the separation timeline.

The question demonstrates depth by requesting a holistic explanation of the program, requiring detailed knowledge of NASA's HR policies and separation procedures. It is clear, specific, and would help HR professionals ensure accurate communication and proper implementation of the DRP.

The broad yet focused nature of the question makes it extremely valuable for anyone involved in managing employee separations under this program, offering insights into procedural, financial, and administrative aspects of the Deferred Resignation Program.

reference: According to NASA's Final Separation Agreement, the Deferred Resignation Program offers several key provisions. Employees who participate will not be subject to any reduction in pay and benefits by NASA and will be exempted from all applicable in-person work requirements until their resignation date. Specifically, accepted employees are placed on paid administrative leave through the Deferred Resignation Period, during which they are not expected to work and are exempt from any return-to-office requirements. The Agency continues to pay the employee's current salary, and employees retain all benefits of federal employment, including TSP contributions, health, dental, vision, and similar benefits, with NASA making the government's contribution. Employees also continue to receive retirement service credit consistent with applicable retirement provisions, and they continue to accrue annual and sick leave during this period. If eligible for a within-grade increase during the deferred resignation period, the Agency will process it and the employee will receive the associated salary increase. Additionally, employees will receive a lump sum payment for accrued annual leave upon separation from service.
groundedness_score_reasoning: The context provides comprehensive and detailed information about the Deferred Resignation Program's provisions, including full salary continuation, maintenance of all benefits, exemption from in-person work requirements, and specific protections for employees during the administrative leave period.
relevancy_score_reasoning:
This question is highly useful for HR specialists, supervisors, and program administrators managing Deferred Resignation Program cases. It directly addresses critical aspects of the DRP that require precise understanding and careful administrative handling. The question covers multiple essential elements:

1. Relevance: It focuses specifically on key provisions of the Final Separation Agreement, which is central to DRP administration.

2. Practicality: The question targets practical concerns that directly impact employee compensation, benefits status, and work expectations during the administrative leave period.

3. Clarity: The question is clearly structured, asking about specific components (pay, benefits, work requirements) in a straightforward manner.

4. Depth: It requires comprehensive knowledge of NASA HR policies, DRP procedural details, and separation agreement nuances.

5. Applicability: Understanding these provisions is crucial for ensuring proper implementation of the Deferred Resignation Program, maintaining compliance, and providing accurate guidance to employees in transition.

HR professionals would find this question extremely valuable as it encompasses the most critical administrative and policy considerations in processing a Deferred Resignation Program case.

the Deferred Resignation Program and the Agency accepts Employee’s request to be included in the Deferred Resignation Program. Accordingly, the p arties agree as follows:

3. Employee agrees to turn in all Agency equipment and property no later than the Administrative Leave Start Date, as directed by Employee’s supervisor.

4. Employee shall not be expected to work during the Deferred Resignation Period and shall be exempt from any return-to-office requirements.

5. During the Deferred Resignation Period, Agency shall continue to pay Employee’s current salary and Employee shall continue to retain and receive all benefits of Employee’s federal employment, including but not limited to TSP contributions, health, dental, vision and/or any other similar benefits, with the Agency making the government’s contribution. Employee will receive retirement service credit during the deferred resignation period consistent with the retirement provisions applicable to Employee. If Employee becomes eligible for a within- grade increase during the deferred resignation period, the Agency shall process the within- grade increase and Employee shall receive the associated salary increase.

6. Employee will continue to accrue annual and sick leave during the deferred resignation period. Employee will receive a lump sum payment of accrued annual leave in accordance with 5 CFR part 550 upon separation from service.

1

Version: June 12, 2025

including but not limited to receiving back pay consistent with the Government Employee Fair Treatment Act of 2019.

8. Agency shall comply with all terms of this agreement even if Employee’s position is eliminated or reassigned prior to . Employee shall not be subject to furlough, termination, reduction in force or layoff as a result of an agency-initiated reorganization or reduction in force. Employee agrees to cooperate with steps taken by Agency to exempt Employee from any reduction in force.

9. Nothing in this agreement prevents Employee from retiring from federal service at any time if Employee is eligible to do so under the applicable provisions of CSRS or FERS prior to . reference: The Deferred Resignation Program at NASA allows employees to voluntarily request deferred resignation while maintaining their pay and benefits. According to the Final Separation Agreement, employees accepted into the program are placed on paid administrative leave starting from an Administrative Leave Start Date through a specified end date (or earlier if the employee chooses to resign sooner). During this Deferred Resignation Period, employees continue to receive their current salary and retain all federal employment benefits, including TSP contributions, health, dental, vision, and similar benefits with the Agency making the government's contribution. Importantly, employees will receive retirement service credit during this period consistent with applicable retirement provisions. Employees continue to accrue annual and sick leave and will receive a lump sum payment for accrued annual leave upon separation. If there's a lapse in appropriations during the Deferred Resignation Period, employees maintain the same rights as other NASA employees, including receiving back pay consistent with the Government Employee Fair Treatment Act of 2019. The agreement also specifies that if an employee is eligible to retire under CSRS or FERS provisions before the end of the Deferred Resignation Period, they may do so, but their retirement election would override any benefits available under the agreement after their separation date. The employee would be responsible for submitting their CSRS or FERS application.
groundedness_score_reasoning: The context provides comprehensive and detailed information directly addressing all aspects of the question, including retirement service credit, benefits retention, early retirement options, and handling of potential lapse in appropriations during the Deferred Resignation Program.
relevancy_score_reasoning:
This question has moderate usefulness for an HR specialist or program administrator. While the inquiry touches on some important aspects of the Deferred Resignation Program (DRP), such as benefits, retirement service credit, and potential program interruptions, the language and presentation are informal and somewhat unfocused.

Strengths:
- Addresses key concerns about benefits and retirement service credit
- Raises valid questions about program flexibility and potential scenarios
- Demonstrates genuine interest in understanding DRP mechanics

Weaknesses:
- Lacks professional tone and specificity
- Question is somewhat rambling and could be more precisely articulated
- Personal context (caring for a parent) is not clearly linked to specific DRP eligibility criteria

The question would benefit from more structured phrasing and specific details about the individual's employment status, length of service, and precise circumstances. However, it does highlight important considerations that HR professionals would need to address when counseling an employee about the Deferred Resignation Program.

An HR specialist would likely need to follow up with the individual to gather more precise information and provide a comprehensive explanation of DRP terms, retirement service credit preservation, and potential scenarios involving program interruption.

reference: The NASA Deferred Resignation Program allows employees to separate from service while maintaining financial stability. Under this program, employees are placed on paid administrative leave until their resignation date, continuing to receive their current salary and all federal employment benefits including TSP contributions, health, dental, and vision coverage with the government making its contribution. Importantly, employees will receive retirement service credit during the deferred resignation period consistent with applicable retirement provisions. They continue to accrue annual and sick leave, and will receive a lump sum payment for accrued annual leave upon separation. If eligible, employees can choose to retire under CSRS or FERS provisions before their deferred resignation date, though this would override any benefits available under the agreement after the effective separation date.

Strengths:
- Directly references the DRP and retirement benefits, which are key areas of interest
- Suggests the questioner is seeking information about an important aspect of employee separation

- No clear indication of the specific information needed (e.g., eligibility, calculation method, timing of benefits)
- Lacks the precision required for a targeted HR inquiry

To improve the usefulness, the question would benefit from more specific framing, such as:
- "How are retirement benefits calculated for employees in the NASA Deferred Resignation Program?"
- "What retirement benefits are available to employees participating in the NASA DRP?"

The current formulation requires significant clarification to be truly actionable for an HR professional processing DRP cases.

reference:
The Deferred Resignation Program is a voluntary option offered by NASA to employees through an email communication sent on June 9, 2025. According to the Final Separation Agreement, employees who accept this offer will not face any reduction in pay and benefits, and they will be exempted from all applicable in-person work requirements until their resignation date, which they can choose to accelerate if desired.

Employees accepted into the program will be placed on paid administrative leave starting on the "Administrative Leave Start Date" and will remain on paid administrative leave through the "Deferred Resignation Period." They are required to turn in all Agency equipment and property no later than the Administrative Leave Start Date, as directed by their supervisor.

During the Deferred Resignation Period, employees are not expected to work and are exempt from any return-to-office requirements. The Agency will continue to pay the employee's current salary, and employees will retain all benefits of federal employment, including TSP contributions, health, dental, vision, and similar benefits, with the Agency making the government's contribution. Employees will also receive retirement service credit during this period consistent with applicable retirement provisions. If eligible for a within-grade increase during this period, the Agency will process it and the employee will receive the associated salary increase.

Employees will continue to accrue annual and sick leave during the deferred resignation period and will receive a lump sum payment of accrued annual leave upon separation from service.

In case of a government shutdown (lapse in appropriations) during the Deferred Resignation Period, employees will be subject to the lapse and entitled to back pay in the same manner as other NASA employees. They retain all existing rights covering such lapses, including receiving back pay consistent with the Government Employee Fair Treatment Act of 2019.
groundedness_score_reasoning: The context provides comprehensive and detailed information directly addressing every aspect of the question, including the date of the email (June 9, 2025), the specifics of the Deferred Resignation Program, details about continued pay and benefits, equipment return requirements, retirement service credit, and even provisions for a potential government shutdown.
relevancy_score_reasoning:
While the question touches on several important aspects of the Deferred Resignation Program, it lacks clarity and professional language. The query demonstrates some genuine interest in understanding DRP, but its vague and informal phrasing reduces its usefulness for an HR professional. 

The question does cover potentially relevant topics such as:
- Program details
- Communication timelines
- Pay and benefits status
- Equipment return procedures
- Retirement eligibility
- Impact of government shutdown

However, the poor articulation and grammatical issues make it difficult to extract precise information. An HR specialist would need to significantly restructure the question to provide a comprehensive and accurate response. The lack of specificity and professional terminology suggests this is more of an initial, exploratory inquiry rather than a focused administrative request.

To improve the question's utility, it would need to be reworded more formally, with specific details about the employee's specific situation, job classification, and precise information requirements. user_input: What are the key benefits and conditions for NASA employees considering early retirement through the Deferred Resignation Program, and how does it affect their pay, benefits, and work requirements until final separation?
reference_contexts:
["<1-hop>

page_content='Final Separation Agreement

This agreement is between the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (“NASA”

or “Agency”) and the Employee identified below.

On June 9, 2025, NASA circulated an email communication to employees offering them a voluntary deferred resignation option. The offer stated that those employees who accept the offer will not be subject to any reduction in pay and benefits by NASA and exempted them from all applicable in-person work requirements until or earlier if they choose to accelerate the resignation date for any reason. (“Deferred Resignation Program”).

the Deferred Resignation Program and the Agency accepts Employee’s request to be included in the Deferred Resignation Program. Accordingly, the p arties agree as follows:

NASA has

received Employee’s voluntary

request

to be

included

in

1. Employee is accepted into the Deferred Resignation Program in accordance with the terms of this agreement.

2. Employee shall be placed on paid administrative leave on (the “Administrative Leave Start Date”). Employee shall remain on paid administrative leave up through and including or such earlier date on which Employee may choose to resign or otherwise separate from federal service (Deferred Resignation Period).

3. Employee agrees to turn in all Agency equipment and property no later than the Administrative Leave Start Date, as directed by Employee’s supervisor.

4. Employee shall not be expected to work during the Deferred Resignation Period and shall be exempt from any return-to-office requirements.

5. During the Deferred Resignation Period, Agency shall continue to pay Employee’s current salary and Employee shall continue to retain and receive all benefits of Employee’s federal employment, including but not limited to TSP contributions, health, dental, vision and/or any other similar benefits, with the Agency making the government’s contribution. Employee will receive retirement service credit during the deferred resignation period consistent with the retirement provisions applicable to Employee. If Employee becomes eligible for a within- grade increase during the deferred resignation period, the Agency shall process the within- grade increase and Employee shall receive the associated salary increase.

6. Employee will continue to accrue annual and sick leave during the deferred resignation period. Employee will receive a lump sum payment of accrued annual leave in accordance with 5 CFR part 550 upon separation from service.

7.

If there is a lapse in appropriations during the Deferred Resignation Period Employee shall be subject to any lapse and entitled to any back pay consisted in the same manner as any other NASA employee. Employee will retain all existing rights covering such lapse in appropriations regardless of their status as a Deferred Resignation Program participant

1

Version: June 12, 2025

including but not limited to receiving back pay consistent with the Government Employee Fair Treatment Act of 2019.

8. Agency shall comply with all terms of this agreement even if Employee’s position is eliminated or reassigned prior to . Employee shall not be subject to furlough, termination, reduction in force or layoff as a result of an agency-initiated reorganization or reduction in force. Employee agrees to cooperate with steps taken by Agency to exempt Employee from any reduction in force.

9. Nothing in this agreement prevents Employee from retiring from federal service at any time if Employee is eligible to do so under the applicable provisions of CSRS or FERS prior to . If Employee is eligible and elects to retire before , Employee’s retirement election shall override any benefits that would be available to Employee under this agreement after the effective date of Employee’s separation. Employee understands that Employee is responsible for submitting a CSRS or FERS application."]
reference: The Deferred Resignation Program offered by NASA on June 9, 2025 provides several key benefits for employees considering early separation. Employees accepted into the program will be placed on paid administrative leave starting on an agreed date and will remain on this status until their resignation date. During this Deferred Resignation Period, employees continue to receive their current salary and retain all federal employment benefits, including TSP contributions, health, dental, vision, and similar benefits, with NASA making the government's contribution. Employees also continue to accrue retirement service credit consistent with applicable retirement provisions, and remain eligible for within-grade salary increases. Additionally, annual and sick leave continue to accrue, with a lump sum payment for accrued annual leave provided upon separation according to 5 CFR part 550. Importantly, participants are exempted from all in-person work requirements and are not expected to work during this period. They must turn in all Agency equipment by the Administrative Leave Start Date. The agreement also protects employees from furlough, termination, reduction in force, or layoff resulting from agency reorganization. Employees retain the right to retire earlier than the agreed date if eligible under CSRS or FERS provisions, though this would override any benefits available under the agreement after the effective separation date.
groundedness_score_reasoning: The context provides comprehensive and detailed information about the Deferred Resignation Program, covering all key aspects of the question including pay continuation, benefit preservation, work exemptions, leave accrual, and protection from reduction in force, making it possible to fully and unambiguously answer the question.
relevancy_score_reasoning:
This question is highly useful for HR specialists, supervisors, and program administrators managing Deferred Resignation Program (DRP) cases. It directly addresses critical aspects of the program by comprehensively exploring:

1. Key benefits of the DRP
2. Specific conditions for participation
3. Potential impacts on employee compensation
4. Implications for benefits
5. Work requirements during the transition period

The question demonstrates depth by requiring a nuanced understanding of NASA's HR policies, early retirement procedures, and administrative complexities. It is practical and actionable, providing essential information for employees considering DRP and for HR professionals guiding them through the process.

The broad yet specific nature of the question allows for a comprehensive overview that would help HR specialists explain program details, assist employees in making informed decisions, and ensure proper administrative handling of early retirement transitions. Its relevance to personnel management, benefits administration, and organizational workforce planning makes it extremely valuable for DRP-related decision-making and processing.

The agreement also protects employees from furlough, termination, reduction in force, or layoff resulting from agency reorganization. Employees retain the option to retire earlier if eligible under CSRS or FERS provisions, though this would override benefits available under the deferred resignation agreement after separation.

They also receive retirement service credit consistent with applicable retirement provisions, and if eligible, will receive within-grade increases. During any lapse in appropriations, they maintain the same rights as other NASA employees, including back pay under the Government Employee Fair Treatment Act of 2019. 9. Nothing in this agreement prevents Employee from retiring from federal service at any time if Employee is eligible to do so under the applicable provisions of CSRS or FERS prior to . If Employee is eligible and elects to retire before , Employee’s retirement election shall override any benefits that would be available to Employee under this agreement after the effective date of Employee’s separation. page_content='Final Separation Agreement

This agreement is between the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (“NASA”

or “Agency”) and the Employee identified below.

On June 9, 2025, NASA circulated an email communication to employees offering them a voluntary deferred resignation option. The offer stated that those employees who accept the offer will not be subject to any reduction in pay and benefits by NASA and exempted them from all applicable in-person work requirements until or earlier if they choose to accelerate the resignation date for any reason. (“Deferred Resignation Program”).

the Deferred Resignation Program and the Agency accepts Employee’s request to be included in the Deferred Resignation Program. Accordingly, the p arties agree as follows:

NASA has

received Employee’s voluntary

request

to be

included

in

1. Employee is accepted into the Deferred Resignation Program in accordance with the terms of this agreement.

2. Employee shall be placed on paid administrative leave on (the “Administrative Leave Start Date”). Employee shall remain on paid administrative leave up through and including or such earlier date on which Employee may choose to resign or otherwise separate from federal service (Deferred Resignation Period).

3. Employee agrees to turn in all Agency equipment and property no later than the Administrative Leave Start Date, as directed by Employee’s supervisor.

4. Employee shall not be expected to work during the Deferred Resignation Period and shall be exempt from any return-to-office requirements.

5. During the Deferred Resignation Period, Agency shall continue to pay Employee’s current salary and Employee shall continue to retain and receive all benefits of Employee’s federal employment, including but not limited to TSP contributions, health, dental, vision and/or any other similar benefits, with the Agency making the government’s contribution. Employee will receive retirement service credit during the deferred resignation period consistent with the retirement provisions applicable to Employee. If Employee becomes eligible for a within- grade increase during the deferred resignation period, the Agency shall process the within- grade increase and Employee shall receive the associated salary increase.

6. Employee will continue to accrue annual and sick leave during the deferred resignation period. Employee will receive a lump sum payment of accrued annual leave in accordance with 5 CFR part 550 upon separation from service.

7.

If there is a lapse in appropriations during the Deferred Resignation Period Employee shall be subject to any lapse and entitled to any back pay consisted in the same manner as any other NASA employee. Employee will retain all existing rights covering such lapse in appropriations regardless of their status as a Deferred Resignation Program participant

1

Version: June 12, 2025

including but not limited to receiving back pay consistent with the Government Employee Fair Treatment Act of 2019.

8. Agency shall comply with all terms of this agreement even if Employee’s position is eliminated or reassigned prior to . Employee shall not be subject to furlough, termination, reduction in force or layoff as a result of an agency-initiated reorganization or reduction in force. Employee agrees to cooperate with steps taken by Agency to exempt Employee from any reduction in force.

9. Nothing in this agreement prevents Employee from retiring from federal service at any time if Employee is eligible to do so under the applicable provisions of CSRS or FERS prior to . If Employee is eligible and elects to retire before , Employee’s retirement election shall override any benefits that would be available to Employee under this agreement after the effective date of Employee’s separation. Employee understands that Employee is responsible for submitting a CSRS or FERS application."]
reference: If you join the NASA Deferred Resignation Program but then decide to retire early from federal service before the end date, you can do so if you're eligible under CSRS or FERS provisions. According to the agreement, "Nothing in this agreement prevents Employee from retiring from federal service at any time if Employee is eligible to do so under the applicable provisions of CSRS or FERS prior to [the end date]." However, your retirement election would override any benefits that would have been available under the Deferred Resignation Program agreement after your separation date. You would be responsible for submitting your own CSRS or FERS application for retirement. This means you could choose to leave federal service earlier than the agreed end date of the Deferred Resignation Period if you qualify for retirement.
groundedness_score_reasoning: The context directly addresses the scenario of early retirement in section 9, which explicitly states that if the employee is eligible and elects to retire before the end date, their retirement election will override the benefits of the Deferred Resignation Program, providing a clear and comprehensive answer to the question.

The query is clear and seeks important information about the procedural consequences of altering one's original DRP participation plan.
